componentDescription: Responsively hides children based on the selected implementation.

propDescriptions.implementation: Specify which implementation to use.  'js' is the default, 'css' works better for server-side rendering.
propDescriptions.initialWidth:
You can use this prop when choosing the js implementation with server-side rendering.
As window.innerWidth is unavailable on the server, we default to rendering an empty component during the first mount. You might want to use a heuristic to approximate the screen width of the client browser screen width.
For instance, you could be using the user-agent or the client-hints. https://caniuse.com/#search=client%20hint
propDescriptions.lgDown: If true, component is hidden on screens below (but not including) this size.
propDescriptions.lgUp: If true, component is hidden on screens this size and above.
propDescriptions.mdDown: If true, component is hidden on screens below (but not including) this size.
propDescriptions.mdUp: If true, component is hidden on screens this size and above.
propDescriptions.smDown: If true, component is hidden on screens below (but not including) this size.
propDescriptions.smUp: If true, component is hidden on screens this size and above.
propDescriptions.xlDown: If true, component is hidden on screens below (but not including) this size.
propDescriptions.xlUp: If true, component is hidden on screens this size and above.
propDescriptions.xsDown: If true, component is hidden on screens below (but not including) this size.
propDescriptions.xsUp: If true, component is hidden on screens this size and above.
